p: Figure 3A shows that without rGSH, MVA infectivity decreased significantly compared to the control at both 20 and 24 kV, but with rGSH, a significant reduction was only seen at 24 kV. Additionally, at 24 kV, MVA without rGSH was significantly less active than MVA with rGSH. Figure 3B, in contrast, indicates that Ad was tolerant across all of the electrospraying conditions tested. One of the main differences between MVA and Ad is the presence of a lipid envelope surrounding the virus.
